Key Match Events: Neco Williams scored an unstoppable free-kick
Daniel James rounded the Finland goalkeeper and captain, Lukas Hradecky, after a dawdling Miro Tenho error
David Brooks opened the scoring early on
Teemu Pukki scored for Finland before the break
Brennan Johnson scored two minutes into the second half
Daniel James scored the fourth goal in the 86th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Wales needed fresh blood to fire
Several of the starting lineup would have been rooting for Wales at school then
Poland awaits after they demolished 10-man Estonia 5-1 in their semi-final
Robert Lewandowski was not on the scoresheet
Wales manager, Rob Page, said the next few days are tantamount to the half-time interval
Post-Match Reflections: There was a warm outpouring of applause at the final whistle
Page was double fist-pumping into the air inside three minutes
Chris Mepham and Ben Davies were guilty of getting sucked into the ball and Joel Pohjanpalo managed to free Pukki
Wales manager, Rob Page, said Wales will 'go toe to toe' with Poland in bid to reach Euros
Kieffer Moore began among the substitutes
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gareth Bale scored twice in a similar free-kick in a previous World Cup playoff semi-final
Wales could hardly have got off to a better start
Johnson’s strike restored Wales’s two-goal advantage
Wilson’s free-kick flew towards the back post, Ethan Ampadu attacked the ball and after Brooks failed to make clean contact, Johnson hooked it past Hradecky
Brooks left the pitch to a standing ovation
Moore skittled a shot at Hradecky and Davies had a header disallowed late on
